revised_title: All-female Broods in Butterflies: A Study on Hypolimnas bolina
tldr: The authors studied all-female broods in the butterfly Hypolimnas bolina and found that the abnormal sex ratio is due to high mortality in male embryos and larvae. They discovered that the difference between the two types of broods is likely to be due to a difference in the mortality pattern between the sexes. The study provides evidence that differential mortality plays a significant role in the production of all-female broods in H. bolina.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
